carousel_items: Acne can take several weeks to show up in the skin so it's best to use for 2-3 months before you decide it doesn't work.
Studies showed it didn't matter what strength people used, they all took about the same time to work.
Higher strengths greater than 2.5% may not work any better but might cause more side effects.
Using a moisturizer that doesn't block your pores (non-comedogenic) may help lessen common side effects of skin dryness and peeling.
Taking good care of your skin is an important part of treating acne. Lightly wash with warm water and non-soap-based or gentle cleanser.

basics.benefits_moa: Benzoyl peroxide is a topical acne medicine. It seems to fight the bacteria responsible for producing acne in oil (sebaceous) glands, and dries out acne-affected areas. Also, it speeds up growth of damaged skin from serious breakdown, injury, or disease.
basics.bottom_line: Benzoyl peroxide is a very popular topical acne treatment you can get over-the-counter or by prescription that may be better for people who don't want to take pill medication. Just be careful because it can bleach your hair, clothing and other fabrics.
downsides: Higher strengths (concentrations) can cause skin irritation and may appear as redness, peeling, abnormal dryness or stinging, tightening, or burning sensations.
It's rare, that a serious allergic reaction would occur, but it's a good idea to test a small area of skin before using on any larger or sensitive areas.

Not the best choice if you're pregnant. Benzoyl peroxide is categorized as pregnancy Category C (weigh risks vs benefits) as compared to similar topical medicines that are in Category B (likely safe).
Can cause bleaching of hair and clothing.
May not work as well when used by itself over long period of time.
You'll need to stay out of the sun or apply a sunscreen if you have to be outdoors.

downsides_processed.orig: Higher strengths (concentrations) can cause skin irritation and may appear as redness, peeling, abnormal dryness or stinging, tightening, or burning sensations.
It's rare, that a serious allergic reaction would occur, but it's a good idea to test a small area of skin before using on any larger or sensitive areas.

Not the best choice if you're pregnant. Benzoyl peroxide is categorized as pregnancy Category C (weigh risks vs benefits) as compared to similar topical medicines that are in Category B (likely safe).
Can cause bleaching of hair and clothing.
May not work as well when used by itself over long period of time.
You'll need to stay out of the sun or apply a sunscreen if you have to be outdoors.

upsides: Benzoyl peroxide is used to reduce bacteria on the skin, which "calms" the skin down (lowers the inflammatory response) in acne.
Helps stop blemishes from forming when oil and skin cells become trapped in pores.
Although Benzoyl peroxide can irritate the skin, a true skin allergy is rare.
Can be used in combination with acne pill medicine if your doctor thinks you need it.
It's available in non-prescription strengths, easy to buy at any drugstore and pretty cheap compared to prescription pills to treat your acne.

upsides_processed.orig: Benzoyl peroxide is used to reduce bacteria on the skin, which "calms" the skin down (lowers the inflammatory response) in acne.
Helps stop blemishes from forming when oil and skin cells become trapped in pores.
Although Benzoyl peroxide can irritate the skin, a true skin allergy is rare.
Can be used in combination with acne pill medicine if your doctor thinks you need it.
It's available in non-prescription strengths, easy to buy at any drugstore and pretty cheap compared to prescription pills to treat your acne.

drugs.one_liner: Topical treatment for acne and skin wounds.
drugs.name: Benzoyl peroxide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Acne can take several weeks to show up in the skin so it's best to use for 2-3 months before you decide it doesn't work.
Studies showed it didn't matter what strength people used, they all took about the same time to work.
Higher strengths greater than 2.5% may not work any better but might cause more side effects.
Using a moisturizer that doesn't block your pores (non-comedogenic) may help lessen common side effects of skin dryness and peeling.
Taking good care of your skin is an important part of treating acne. Lightly wash with warm water and non-soap-based or gentle cleanser.

risks_warnings.title: Bleaching effects
risks_warnings.description: Benzoyl peroxide can bleach hair, fabrics and carpet. Be careful to avoid hairline when applying to face. Wash your hands after using to avoid staining or discoloring fabrics and clothing.

description_processed.orig: Benzoyl peroxide can bleach hair, fabrics and carpet. Be careful to avoid hairline when applying to face. Wash your hands after using to avoid staining or discoloring fabrics and clothing.

risks_warnings.title: Skin irritation
risks_warnings.description: Benzoyl peroxide may cause skin redness, burning, peeling or swelling. It might improve if you use a formula that weaker, or less often.
risk_factors: Using other medicines or products that irritate the skin

description_processed.orig: Benzoyl peroxide may cause skin redness, burning, peeling or swelling. It might improve if you use a formula that weaker, or less often.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Benzoyl peroxide can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately. It may occur immediately longer, after continued use.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Benzoyl peroxide can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately. It may occur immediately longer, after continued use.

points.notes: same prose of warnings/SEs for all topical forms
points.name: Skin irritation

carousel_items: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

basics.benefits_moa: Metronidazole is an antibiotic that kills bacteria by cutting off their supply of energy and ruining their DNA.
basics.bottom_line: Metronidazole is a very good way to treat certain bacteria infections, but you can't have any alcohol while on it since it'll make you throw up. A lot.
downsides: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

upsides: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

upsides_processed.orig: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: If you are hypersensitive to medications (i.e., several drug allergies), PLEASE check with your medical professional for alternatives. Side effect (arthralgia - joint pain) are STILL present after 2.5 days of taking, 7 weeks later!
userStories.indication: Was given when PID was suspected (ended up not being)

drugs.name: Flagyl

labeled_indications.indication: Colorectal infection prevention after a surgery

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mental status | Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

risks_warnings.title: Aseptic meningitis
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.

description_processed.orig: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.

carousel_items: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Take this medication with plenty of fluids.
Space out any medications containing aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches and insomnia.

basics.benefits_moa: Levofloxacin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Levofloxacin is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as generic. However, it can cause damage to your tendons, and make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
downsides: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.
You have to space out any medications with aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches, and insomnia.

downsides_processed.orig: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.
You have to space out any medications with aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches, and insomnia.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

userStories.tip: It ruined multiple tendons in both my hands. I had to have the tendons surgically repaired. After that I developed tendon damage in both legs and my rotator cuff-but it totally cleared up my sinus infection!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I stopped taking this medicine after I started having pain in my achilles tendon. I was afraid my tendon would rupture and that I would never be comfortable running again. The pain lasted for a few weeks! Don't take it unless you have to!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Had to stop after 3 days. Serious side effects. Too strong for me!

Do not take this medication! It will mess up your joints/tendons and cause multiple other problems. There are several FB groups with 1000's of victims from being "Floxed".  Cipro causes same damage also! Do your Research before taking!!!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

drugs.name: Levaquin

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Take this medication with plenty of fluids.
Space out any medications containing aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches and insomnia.

risks_warnings.title: Tendon rupture
risks_warnings.description: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

description_processed.orig: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

description_processed.orig: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Levofloxacin. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

description_processed.orig: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Levofloxacin. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Levofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Levofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.
